results.title: R.A.N. ashore and afloat: it's the navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
Special 1000th issue of Cinesound Review devoted to the Royal Australian Navy; the Senior Service. Class room training and recruitment is put to good use aboard the H.M.A.S. Latrobe. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Drought grips Riverina
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel (Ep. 679) consisting of one “full-reel” item: “Drought grips Riverina”, alerting the public to the severity of the drought, and criticising the destructive abuse of the land by farmers who overstock. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Moresby under the blitz
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel. This issue is a film by Damien Parer of the war in New Guinea, including his dramatic footage of the bombing of the Macdhul.

results.title: China: unleashing the dragon
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description: Chronicles the transformation currently sweeping over China from its birth under the policies of Deng Xiaoping to the economic, social and cultural realities of modern day China.

results.title: The Future of Hong Kong: China's gateway to the international community
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Examines what may lie ahead for China and Hong Kong and how it will interact with the international cultural and economic community. For some it is a celebration, for others it is a move to be questioned.

results.title: The Heart of the matter: the decline of traditional cultural values
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Illustrates how changing values and economic pressures are influencing popular culture and traditional values. Profiles a young salesmanager in women’s fashion, who is estranged from her family and communist values and compares a female rock singer with a former star of the Peking Opera. The second part of the program looks at some of the pressures on rural families resulting from the new materialism and rapid economic growth. A range of people voice their concerns about the decline of traditions and the danger of losing the soul of China in the rush for economic and social change.
